The corkscrew can be used as a makeshift drill to create small holes in materials such as wood or plastic.
A corkscrew can be used to open up tight spaces between objects, such as removing a stuck object from between two other objects.
The corkscrew can be used to clean out stubborn debris or dirt from small crevices and tight spaces.
A corkscrew can be used as a tool to manipulate small objects, such as screws, nails, or even wires.
The corkscrew can be used as a makeshift awl to pierce holes in leather or other materials.
